intro: Hybanthus mossamedensis, commonly known as the Mossamedes hybanthus, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
